intro: Plagiolophus millspaughii, commonly known as the Millspaugh's false hellebore, is a rare and striking member of the Araceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves that are often speckled with white or yellow spots. The plant produces an unusual inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
